result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Sperber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a minimum 250 word apology letter to the victim, Bayship. This should be done within the first 30 days of probation.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Sperber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d).

Defendant John M Sperber in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Email from COC to Atty Schenk with signed subpoenas.
from Atty Schenk requesting jury list and questionnaires

Defendant John M Sperber in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Schenk indicates matter is not resolved, will be proceeding to trial. Court indicates this matter is in the #2 position for trial. Court will let defense know by 2/03/17 whether matter will be proceeding to trial or not. Bond remains in effect.
from Atty Schenk requesting matter be set for pretrial and trial.
Jury trial on February 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 19, 2017 at 09:15 am.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant John M Sperber in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Aaron Schenk appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schenk indicates defendant was unable to get off of work today, defendant also indicated to Atty Schenk that he didn't receive notice of todays hearing. Court reschedules matter.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
from Atty Schenk requesting to reschedule 7/14/16 IA because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Initial appearance on July 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
